intro: Hieracium speirodon, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a hairy texture. It has a taproot system and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Hieracium speirodon is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
